channel.title: security on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in security on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Suspicious Computer Account Name Change CVE-2021-42287
item.description: Detects the renaming of an existing computer account to a account name that doesn’t contain a $ symbol as seen in attacks against CVE-2021-42287

item.title: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability
item.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject

item.title: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability with Risky EKU
item.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject and risky EKU

item.title: Correct Execution of Nltest.exe
item.description: The attacker might use LOLBAS nltest.exe for discovery of domain controllers, domain trusts, parent domain and the current user permissions.

item.title: Azure AD Health Monitoring Agent Registry Keys Access
item.description: This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key of Azure AD Health monitoring agent. This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent.

item.title: Azure AD Health Service Agents Registry Keys Access
item.description: This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key values and sub-keys of Azure AD Health service agents (e.g AD FS). Information from AD Health service agents can be used to potentially abuse some of the features provided by those services in the cloud (e.g. Federation). This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent. Make sure you set the SACL to propagate to its sub-keys.

item.title: Security Event Log Cleared
item.description: Checks for event id 1102 which indicates the security event log was cleared.

item.title: Impacket PsExec Execution
item.description: Detects execution of Impacket’s psexec.py.

item.title: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
item.description: This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop. Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.

item.title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog
item.description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Threshold according to domain width.

item.title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
item.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

item.title: Operation Wocao Activity
item.description: Detects activity mentioned in Operation Wocao report

item.title: External Disk Drive Or USB Storage Device
item.description: Detects external diskdrives or plugged in USB devices , EventID 6416 on windows 10 or later

item.title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
item.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like

item.title: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
item.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers

item.title: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
item.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.

item.title: LSASS Access from Non System Account
item.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account

item.title: Protected Storage Service Access
item.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers

item.title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
item.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

item.title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
item.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts similar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

item.title: New or Renamed User Account with '$' in Attribute 'SamAccountName'.
item.description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.

item.title: Possible DC Shadow
item.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN

item.title: Register new Logon Process by Rubeus
item.description: Detects potential use of Rubeus via registered new trusted logon process

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'
item.description: The ‘LsaRegisterLogonProcess’ function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.

item.title: Windows Defender Exclusion Set
item.description: Detects scenarios where an windows defender exclusion was added in registry where an entity would want to bypass antivirus scanning from windows defender

item.title: Remote PowerShell Sessions Network Connections (WinRM)
item.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting (WinRM) by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986

item.title: AD Object WriteDAC Access
item.description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object

item.title: SCM Database Handle Failure
item.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.

item.title: SCM Database Privileged Operation
item.description: Detects non-system users performing privileged operation os the SCM database

item.title: SysKey Registry Keys Access
item.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Local User Creation
item.description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn’t happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: RDP Login from Localhost
item.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login

item.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
item.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz’s sekurlsa::pth module.

item.title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing
item.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off “Local Group Policy Object Processing” via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as “gpedit.msc”. Please note, that disabling “Local Group Policy Object Processing” may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications – however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

item.title: Admin User Remote Logon
item.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user (depending on internal pattern).

item.title: Secure Deletion with SDelete
item.description: Detects renaming of file while deletion with SDelete tool.

item.title: WCE wceaux.dll Access
item.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host

item.title: Interactive Logon to Server Systems
item.description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems

item.title: Access to ADMIN$ Share
item.description: Detects access to $ADMIN share

item.title: User Added to Local Administrators
item.description: This rule triggers on user accounts that are added to the local Administrators group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

item.title: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object
item.description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Kerberos Manipulation
item.description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages

item.title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms
item.description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create “shortcuts” to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

item.title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Registry Modification
item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.title: CVE-2021-1675 Print Spooler Exploitation IPC Access
item.description: Detects remote printer driver load from Detailed File Share in Security logs that are a sign of successful exploitation attempts against print spooler vulnerability CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

item.title: DCERPC SMB Spoolss Named Pipe
item.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

item.title: Disabled Users Failing To Authenticate From Source Using Kerberos
item.description: Detects failed logins with multiple disabled domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Failed Code Integrity Checks
item.description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

item.title: Hidden Local User Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of a local hidden user account which should not happen for event ID 4720.

item.title: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation
item.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service installation.

item.title: Invalid Users Failing To Authenticate From Single Source Using NTLM
item.description: Detects failed logins with multiple invalid domain accounts from a single source system using the NTLM protocol.

item.title: Invalid Users Failing To Authenticate From Source Using Kerberos
item.description: Detects failed logins with multiple invalid domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.

item.title: ISO Image Mount
item.description: Detects the mount of ISO images on an endpoint

item.title: Lateral Movement Indicator ConDrv
item.description: This event was observed on the target host during lateral movement. The process name within the event contains the process spawned post compromise. Account Name within the event contains the compromised user account name. This event should to be correlated with 4624 and 4688 for further intrusion context.

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: Metasploit SMB Authentication
item.description: Alerts on Metasploit host’s authentications on the domain.

item.title: Mimikatz DC Sync
item.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events

item.title: Multiple Users Attempting To Authenticate Using Explicit Credentials
item.description: Detects a source user failing to authenticate with multiple users using explicit credentials on a host.

item.title: Multiple Users Failing to Authenticate from Single Process
item.description: Detects failed logins with multiple accounts from a single process on the system.

item.title: Multiple Users Remotely Failing To Authenticate From Single Source
item.description: Detects a source system failing to authenticate against a remote host with multiple users.

item.title: Pass the Hash Activity
item.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: PetitPotam Suspicious Kerberos TGT Request
item.description: Detect suspicious Kerberos TGT requests. Once an attacer obtains a computer certificate by abusing Active Directory Certificate Services in combination with PetitPotam, the next step would be to leverage the certificate for malicious purposes. One way of doing this is to request a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket using a tool like Rubeus. This request will generate a 4768 event with some unusual fields depending on the environment. This analytic will require tuning, we recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

item.title: Possible PetitPotam Coerce Authentication Attempt
item.description: Detect PetitPotam coerced authentication activity.

item.title: Possible Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) Exploitation
item.description: Detects Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability aka Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472)

item.title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
item.description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer

item.title: Processes Accessing the Microphone and Webcam
item.description: Potential adversaries accessing the microphone and webcam in an endpoint.

item.title: Reconnaissance Activity
item.description: Detects activity as “net user administrator /domain” and “net group domain admins /domain”

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Remote WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers
item.description: Detect potential adversaries leveraging WMI ActiveScriptEventConsumers remotely to move laterally in a network

item.title: Scanner PoC for CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE Vuln
item.description: Detects the use of a scanner by zerosum0x0 that discovers targets vulnerable to CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE aka BlueKeep

item.title: Scheduled Task Deletion
item.description: Detects scheduled task deletion events. Scheduled tasks are likely to be deleted if not used for persistence. Malicious Software often creates tasks directly under the root node e.g. \TASKNAME

item.title: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share
item.description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).

item.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions
item.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share

item.title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User
item.description: Detects the loading of drivers via ‘SeLoadDriverPrivilege’ required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

item.title: Suspicious Kerberos RC4 Ticket Encryption
item.description: Detects service ticket requests using RC4 encryption type

item.title: Suspicious Multiple File Rename Or Delete Occurred
item.description: Detects multiple file rename or delete events occurrence within a specified period of time by a same user (these events may signalize about ransomware activity).

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Suspicious Remote Logon with Explicit Credentials
item.description: Detects suspicious processes logging on with explicit credentials

item.title: Sysmon Channel Reference Deletion
item.description: Potential threat actor tampering with Sysmon manifest and eventually disabling it

item.title: T1021 DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named iertutil.dll in the C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\ directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
item.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named wbemcomn.dll in the C:\Windows\System32\wbem\ directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Unauthorized System Time Modification
item.description: Detect scenarios where a potentially unauthorized application or user is modifying the system time.

item.title: Using AppVLP To Circumvent ASR File Path Rule
item.description: Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. We are able to abuse “AppVLP” to execute shell commands. Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but we can use it as an abuse binary to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder or to mark a file as a system file.

item.title: Valid Users Failing to Authenticate From Single Source Using Kerberos
item.description: Detects multiple failed logins with multiple valid domain accounts from a single source system using the Kerberos protocol.

item.title: Valid Users Failing to Authenticate from Single Source Using NTLM
item.description: Detects failed logins with multiple valid domain accounts from a single source system using the NTLM protocol.

item.title: VSSAudit Security Event Source Registration
item.description: Detects the registration of the security event source VSSAudit. It would usually trigger when volume shadow copy operations happen.

item.title: Weak Encryption Enabled and Kerberoast
item.description: Detects scenario where weak encryption is enabled for a user profile which could be used for hash/password cracking.

item.title: Windows Network Access Suspicious desktop.ini Action
item.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini remotely over network share, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder’s content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.
